duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as SDOT’s SharePoint Online (SPO) secondary site collector and subject matter expert.
Develop and maintain Microsoft Power Apps (Power Automate, Power BI, Dataverse, Forms).
Design, develop, maintain, and implement systems processes for work order systems, ticketing systems, salary compensation, interview panel pools, Adobe Sign, and other projects.
Gather business and systems requirements, analyze current business and systems processes, and document in UML diagrams, flow charts, and data schemas.
Research, analyze, problem-solve, report, and recommend solutions based on existing systems/tools.
Write complex SQL statements for key workforce teams and act as SDOT HR's department administrator for HRIS (EV-5, payroll, labor reconciliation).
Support department goals in promoting diversity and social justice in keeping with the City’s Race and Social Justice Initiative.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in business, information science, computer science, or related field.

Three (3) years of experience with data analysis, application design, relational databases, data architecture, and graphical information reporting. OR: An equivalent combination of education and experience that demonstrates the ability to perform the position duties.
Previous experience working with macros, VBA, SQL, Python, and various programing languages.
Experience working with Tableau, Power Apps, Power Automation, logic, functions, and algorithms.
Previous experience developing, tracking, and reporting on HR-oriented metrics.
Strong customer service orientation and commitment to customer satisfaction.
Attention to detail, organization, and the ability to actively manage multiple processes.
Ability to effectively work in a multi-cultural workplace with a diverse customer base.

Work is typically performed in a hybrid work environment in which a minimum of 2 days of the work is completed in a City office, and 3 days of the work is completed remotely in a regular 40-hour work week.
